subject: Economics
title: The Cobra Effect: When Incentives Backfire
description: A fast breakdown of The Cobra Effect: When Incentives Backfire for builders.

hook.text: Colonial India had too many cobras. The British offered a bounty for dead cobras.

buildup.text: The government designed a rational incentive: kill cobras, get paid. They assumed people would hunt existing cobras.

discovery.text: When the government discovered the breeding farms and cancelled the bounty, breeders released all their cobras.

twist.text: The same happened in Hanoi with rats. Bounties for rat tails led to people cutting tails and releasing rats to breed.

climax.text: The cobra effect: every incentive changes behavior â€” but not always in the intended direction.

punchline.text: If you pay people to solve a problem, make sure you're not paying them to.

quiz.question: What does the 'cobra effect' demonstrate about incentives?
options: People may game incentives in unintended ways that worsen the original problem
